short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Block all algorithm-recommended content on supported sites.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
There are extremely addicting websites that you may want to block for your digital wellbeing, but you can't actually block them entirely because you need some parts of them. You just want to block the algorithm-recommended feed!

For example, on Reddit, I want to be able to see individual posts so that I can get good answers to Google searches. But I don't want to ever see the homepage or subreddit pages, because those are a never-ending feed of content which is extremely addictive to me.

Right now, this works on Reddit and Youtube. I'll add more sites as needed!
